column4: http://home.oscarfranzen.se/gparted-part2.png   How can i solve this and create one new large partiotion + swap?
how much ram do you have?
2.5gb
start by creating a swap space at the beginning of the drive, about 3g
It looked like this before, deleted the partitions in extended     http://home.oscarfranzen.se/gparted-part.png
do you want a separate home directory?
no
* partition?
just an ext partiton for my files
ubuntu is on sda3
right click the /dev/sda3 and choose edit,  I think you should be able to expand its size
think i have to unmount it then..
yes
tou mean expand it, and the ntake away space at the end and create my new?
sorry, I didnt follow that
Do you mean that i shoukld expand my sda3 with the space beetwen it and my new swap. then decrease it and put all the free space at the end
why do you want the free space at the end?
http://home.oscarfranzen.se/gparted-part3.png
So I can create a new large partition
why not just expand the current one to fill the space?
i want 50gb sda5 for ubuntu and 150+30 for a large file partition
50gb sda3*
i see, well, I don't know.  I'm sure gparted can do it for you.  I bet there is a move partition option.  I would click around.  If it is greyed out, then you probably need to use the livecd
